title: Japanese Core 2000:Step 3
description:
Step 3 is the first of the lower-intermediate Goals. The vocabulary becomes a little more difficult here, with nouns such as 政権 (political power) and verbs such as 備える (provide for). 

_Covers items ranked #401-600_

title: Japanese Core 2000:Step 2
description:
Now that you've warmed up a bit, you're ready to learn some more basic words such as 天気 (weather), and 大学生 (university student), and as きれい(beautiful). Like Step 1, Step 2 covers 200 beginner level items.

_Covers items ranked #201-400_

title: Japanese Core 2000:Step 1
description:
Youkoso! Welcome!

Here's the first Step of our Japanese Core 2000 Series. This Goal covers 200 of the most basic words in Japanese. 

With these first 200 items, you’ll learn: essential verbs such as する (to do), 行く (to go), 見る (to look); words you can use to talk about yourself, your family, and others; seasons, numbers, dates; and words related to learning Japanese.

_Covers items ranked #1-200_

title: BJT Business Japanese Proficiency Test - Core List I (English version)
description:
These are the *fundamental 134 basic words* that i collected while preparing for the BJT Business Japanese Proficiency Test (new name of the Jetro Test).

The BJT test is very similar to a TOEIC examination, focused on measuring your ability to deal with japanese in work-related situations.

Like "TOEIC":http://www.ets.org/toeic/ you can take the test several times until your skill level (measured by a Score and a Level) is good enough for your needs.

Even if you never heard about this test, this list is very useful if you plan to improve you chances of working in japan and want to improve quickly your japanese skills for work and business. 

This is not officially endorsed by "Jetro":http://www.jetro.go.jp/ , but a personal word list that i created to help myself memorize more words and improve my BJT score.
It can help you complement the "official study material":http://www.jetro.go.jp/en/bjt/books/jlrt_guide/  and memorize the most common business related words - and the best part, it's all iKnow! ready - so you don't need to create your own from scratch.

In case you are interested in applying to next BJT examination - if your japanese level is equivalent to the JLPT 2kyu or 1Kyu and you are ready to challenge yourself, then take note of next application deadline, 25th of september, to be able to attend to this year's exam in november.

If you are interested in a long term career in Japan, and you are not an English native speaker - this is my case - you should seriously take in consideration to take both TOEIC and BJT tests once in a while.

To know more about the BJT test and the official preparation books go visit the official site:

"BJT Business Japanese Proficiency Test - JETRO Official Site (English)":http://www.jetro.go.jp/en/bjt/ 

Try this list and feel free to extend, edit and share to make it fit your needs.

title: Japanese Full Core 2000
description:
All Steps from the Japanese Core 2000 Goals combined in one huge goal.

Might be usefull when you have mastered each Step, but you want to review all items further.

title: Genki 1 - Complete Kanji (1-145)
description:
All kanji with all possible combinations listed in the kanji lists of Genki 1.

Some combinations are dull but I was determined to add them all :)

Made for studying for a final kanji test on the book.

NOW COMPLETE!

title: Japanese Slang and Swear Words
description:
THIS ISN'T MEAN'T FOR MINORS~

and if you get in trouble its not my problem^^

this isn't vital, but just in case if a weird old guy starts hitting on you [you can use these words!:]

sorry that i don't have sound for these words, but you should know! (from studying hiragana)

note!:: i also put in some words to differentiate (spelling error?) the difference when speaking like a guy and speaking like a girl

i might take this down but use it wisely!
